text: i'm sure that we all love to travel and
explore new places me too i've always
wanted to travel but i didn't travel at
all when i was growing up because i just
couldn't afford it i even went to
college to become a travel agent because
i had heard that you get to travel quite
a bit if you work as a travel agent well
that didn't work out a long story
fortunately in the recent years we've
done a bit of traveling
i love to plan our trips by myself i
love to do research and explore new
places by myself
it's amazing it's fun it's mind-opening
and eye-opening but when you travel by
yourself not on tour and without a guide
you need to communicate with people and
not just for making an order in a
restaurant or getting coffee you might
get into different sorts of situations
you might get into a hospital god forbid
you might have issues with your hotel or
at customs or you might get lost in an
unknown city in a foreign country
we were in such situations and it is a
little bit unnerving for example a
couple of years ago we went on our first
self-planned trip to rome when we landed
we had wi-fi at the airport we knew
where we needed to go and where our
hotel was but we didn't know how to get
there and as we were on a budget we
couldn't take a taxi so we asked for the
directions at the information desk the
lady told us that we needed to take a
subway train and then a bus and off we
went we went to the subway and sure
thing that when we left the airport we
didn't have the internet so we couldn't
google things when we got off the train
we started searching for the bus we
needed and we couldn't find it for a
very long time so we started asking
people luckily english is an
international language and you can find
someone who speaks english everywhere
we found a person who sent us to another
bus stop we took our bus but we got off
at the wrong stop so once again we
needed help and we started asking people
thank god that we got off the bus not
that far away from our hotel at the time
it was a bit of a problem for me to try
to explain my situation to people and
ask for directions in english because i
was nervous because we were lost
and because i was afraid that people
would not understand me so knowing how
to ask for directions in english is
without a doubt something that will come
in handy owing to the fact that you
might already be stressed when you get
lost so we don't need to stress over
what to say and how to say things in
english so today we'll learn how to ask
for directions in english
but before we get into this i want to
mention the sponsor of today's video
lingoda an online language school stay
tuned to find out more about their offer
first of all when you go up to a person
don't forget to be polite greet them and
excuse yourself because you might be
interrupting or disturbing them the
simplest and the most common thing
people say is excuse me hi could you
help me i got lost or can you help me
but could sounds more polite hello
excuse me i got turned around could you
help me to get turned around is the same
as to get lost or instead of excuse me
you could say sorry to interrupt you if
you see that a person is doing something
or talking to someone
hello sorry to interrupt you i got
turned around could you help me please
if the answer is yes then you can
proceed to ask them the following
questions i need to get to and then say
the name of the street or your hotel or
some attraction or a subway station etc
for example i need to get to steward
hotel in chelsea on 7th avenue could you
tell me the best way to get there or the
quickest way to get there or could you
tell me the best way to get to steward
hotel in chelsea on 7th avenue or what
is the best way to get to steward hotel
in chelsea on 7th avenue or joe's could
you tell me the best way to get to and
say where you need to go or you can use
one of these questions where is do you
know where
or can you tell me the way to and say
where you need to go or what you need to
find you could also ask these questions
how can i get to the empire state
building for instance which subway line
should i take to get to the empire state
building is it far from here can i walk
there can i take a bus to get there or
is it better to take a taxi
if you're traveling on a budget this
would be a reasonable question as taxis
might be very expensive sometimes you
might not know how to spell what you
need to find for example they told you
the name of the street or the name of
the bar on the opposite side of which
the bus stop is
and you'd like to use google maps but
you don't know how to spell that
you might ask could you show me on

spell that if you don't even know where
you are
this happens
if you're not in an english-speaking
country and you can't read signs and
your phone died or if you are like me
you can ask hello excuse me i got turned
around where exactly am i and then ask
how to get to the place you need
alternatively you can ask a person to
use their phone or call a taxi for you
hello excuse me i got turned around and
i don't know how to get to my hotel and
my phone just died could you call a taxi
for me please here's the address of my
hotel yeah a word of advice write down
all the important addresses on a piece
of paper or print them out just as a

nearest bar and ask them if you can
charge your phone there hi excuse me my

logical question might be but will i
understand what people are saying to me
